events.title: Granada surrenders to the Crown of Castile
events.description: The Emirate of Granada signs its surrender to King Ferdinand II of Aragon and Queen Isabella I of Castile, effectively ending Moorish rule in the Iberian Peninsula after centuries of conflict.
events.significance: Marked the completion of the Reconquista and enabled the rise of a unified Spanish crown, with long-term implications for Iberian and global exploration.

events.title: Georgia ratifies the United States Constitution
events.description: The state of Georgia becomes the fourth to ratify the U.S. Constitution, following Delaware, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey.
events.significance: Accelerated the ratification process for the new framework of the U.S. government, contributing to the formation of the United States as a constitutional federation.

events.title: Birth of Isaac Asimov
events.description: Isaac Asimov, a Russian-born American writer and biochemist, is born in Petrovichi, Russia (later immigrates to the United States).
events.significance: One of the most influential science fiction writers of the 20th century; his Foundation and Robot series helped shape the genre and popular science writing.
